body: Not easily, because I can't put the function in TH/THC, since it needs to cross the CPU to CUDA gap, even when CPU and CUDA implementations are in separate shared library. The gap-crossing isn't necessary once we have a single implementation of free, but that's blocked on the allocator. I agree the intent is for this to get killed when we do have a unified free function on storage, but it seems not worth adding a CUDAHook just for this in its current form.
